content: backyard hobbit holes before after simply put my backyard hobbit holes bring me joy every time i look at them this playful design consists of a door windows and chimney the door and windows are double-sided so there is no need to block for extras like my fairytale pumpkins visit my freebie bundle on my designer page i have tons of free patterns to choose from you can even make your hobbit a flower garden or a darling little acorn streetlamp my hope is that hobbit holes spring up all over the world and that they bring the peace of the shire with them copyright 2025 version 2 october 2025 by natasha hanson all rights reserved 1 finished measurements door 2 5 / 6cm window 2 /5cm chimney 1 5 /4cm yarn i used patons classic wool worsted because i like a firm fabric but because the door and windows are double sided it works well in sock/fingering too it will just be smaller main door colors orange pumpkin blue country blue green rich grass and pink rose wooden frames and back colors dark brown brown mustard window center yellow sunshine chimney clay red claret needles one set of double-pointed needles dpns in size us 2 2 75mm or desired size supplies tiny bit of stuffing for smoke toothpick for securing chimney to top of hobbit hole trowel for gardening construction the door and windows are knit entirely in the round on double pointed needles dpns beginning at the center back and ending with pretty decreases at the center front the door knob and window frame are made with embroidery the chimney is also knit in the round it is flipped inside out so you don t have to do all those pesky purl stitches links how to do a french knot how to do a running stitch abbreviations k = knit kfb= knit into the front and the back of the stitch increasing 1 stitch ktbl= knit the next stitch through the back loop making the stitch neater p = purl ssk = slip slip knit slip 2 stitches knit-wise one at a time to your right needle then return the now- turned stitches back to the left needle knit them both together through the back loop decreasing 1 this is a left leaning decrease st s = stitch es 2 hobbit hole door instructions cast on 10 sts in your wooden frame/back color leaving a long tail for stitching up hole and for door knob in finishing divide the stitches over 2 dpns and join to work in the round please note if you find knit front and back increases hard on your hands feel free to substitute them with yarn overs if you want them to remain tight knit your yarn overs through the back loop on next round round 1 knit round 2 kfb k1 kfb k1 kfb repeat 16 sts redistribute the stitches on to 3 dpns needle 1 now has 4 sts and needle
